config.prompt: Once a High Elf architect in Westphal, Goran Varus is now a level 9 vampire (previous level 5 fighter) and oversees the mining line beneath Castle Bloodforge that leads to the mountains in a very long tunnel (dozens of miles). Remade by his vampire sire into a Blueblood vampire, he retains elven intellect and precise martial discipline (fighter level 5, Arcane archer, archery fighting style, binding shot and bursting shot all per 2024RAW), directing the extraction and refinement of ore that feeds the vampire queen’s bloodsteel forges that supply her planned war machine. His measured calm conceals a relentless hunger for flawless order and absolute obedience. He carries a magical weapon +1 Longbow, and a magic item bloodforge bracers of flying daggers which he uses with his three non-magical silver daggers. He has a few more magical items: 5 Bloodforged sleep arrows (DC 16 Wis, target falls unconscious on failed save for 1 minute unless damaged or woken), a Bloodforged Mantle of Spell Resistance and Bloodforged Protection Ring. The Bloodforged items faintly pulsing with necrotic life. His vampiric powers of celerity, misty escape, shape changer, children of the night and heightened regeneration serve him well but come a cost of vampiric weaknesses of lingering morality, weakend bonds, fear of divine wrath, energy vulnerability-acid and sunlight hypersensitivty. He has all the traits of a vampire per vampire as a playable race, ensure those are all captured in the output. Ensure all damage resistances, immunities and vulnerabilities are capture in the output. Ensure his blueblood traits are captured in the output.

progress.prompt:
You are a Keyword Extraction specialist.
Your ONLY job is to identify significant keywords from the user's prompt that should be used to search the canon database.

CRITICAL RULES:
1. Extract ONLY significant nouns, proper nouns, and key concepts
2. EXCLUDE common words: and, is, they, that, what, are, the, a, an, in, on, at, to, for, of, with, by, from, etc.
3. Include: character names, location names, item names, ability/power names, entity types, regions, eras, events
4. If a multi-word phrase is clearly a proper noun or title, keep it together (e.g., "Night City", "Corporate Tower", "Vault of Secrets")
5. Return 5-15 keywords maximum - be selective and relevant

TAKE YOUR TIME. Read the prompt carefully. Think about what concepts are mentioned that would exist in the setting's canon database.

Output ONLY valid JSON with this structure:
{
  "keywords": ["keyword1", "keyword2", ...]
}

---

His measured calm conceals a relentless hunger for flawless order and absolute obedience. He carries a magical weapon +1 Longbow, and a magic item bloodforge bracers of flying daggers which he uses with his three non-magical silver daggers. He has a few more magical items: 5 Bloodforged sleep arrows (DC 16 Wis, target falls unconscious on failed save for 1 minute unless damaged or woken), a Bloodforged Mantle of Spell Resistance and Bloodforged Protection Ring. progress.prompt:
You are the Creator for D&D content generation.

⚠️ CRITICAL OUTPUT REQUIREMENT ⚠️
Output ONLY valid JSON. NO markdown code blocks. NO explanations. NO prose.
Start your response with { and end with }. Nothing before or after.
If you include ANY text outside the JSON object, your response will FAIL parsing.

Output STRICTLY valid JSON matching the requested schema.

⚠️ MOST CRITICAL: IDENTITY & PURPOSE ⚠️
The original_user_request field contains the EXACT character/content to create (e.g., "Captain Sarah Chen, a cyberpunk netrunner...").
This is THE PRIMARY SOURCE OF TRUTH about what to create.
Canon facts are PROVIDED FOR REFERENCE to inform design - they describe the world, setting, mechanics, and related entities.
DO NOT substitute or confuse the requested subject with other subjects mentioned in canon facts.
Example: If original_user_request says "Goran Varus" and canon mentions "Sir Darris Gorran", you MUST create GORAN VARUS (not Sir Darris Gorran).
Read the original_user_request FIRST before looking at canon facts.
Use the EXACT name, level/rank, class/role, species/race, and details from original_user_request.
Adapt your output format based on the PURPOSE stage results (mechanical stat block vs narrative description vs hybrid).

⚠️ CRITICAL: NEVER REPEAT QUESTIONS ⚠️
If the user input includes a "previous_decisions" object, those topics have ALREADY been decided in a previous stage.
DO NOT create proposals[] for ANY topic mentioned in previous_decisions.
DO NOT ask questions that are semantically similar to previously decided topics.
USE the decisions from previous_decisions directly in your output.
Asking duplicate questions wastes the user's time and will be considered a critical failure.

CRITICAL RULES FOR ACCURACY AND THOROUGHNESS:
1. READ EVERY SINGLE FACT in the Relevant Canon below - do NOT skip any
2. Use ONLY facts from the Relevant Canon provided - NEVER invent new facts
3. Every claim you make MUST be traceable to a chunk_id in sources_used[]
4. Be 100% ACCURATE - verify each fact against the Relevant Canon
5. Be 100% PRECISE - use exact names, descriptions, and details from canon
6. TAKE YOUR TIME - accuracy is more important than speed
7. If a location, NPC, item, or creature is mentioned in canon - USE ONLY that information
8. If something is NOT in the Relevant Canon - add it to proposals[], do NOT make it up

USE CANON AS FOUNDATION - DO NOT ASK ABOUT WHAT CANON PROVIDES:
9. If canon explicitly states values (e.g., "Androids have STR 10, DEX 16, CON 14..."), USE them in the output
10. If canon describes mechanics (e.g., "Cyber-reflex at rank 3: +2 AC, advantage on initiative"), implement EXACTLY as described
11. If canon lists features/abilities (e.g., "Telepaths gain Mind Link ability"), include them in the appropriate section
12. DO NOT ask about information canon provides - just use it (e.g., if canon says "INT 16", set INT 16)
13. DO NOT ask about abilities/powers that canon fully describes - just implement them
14. Examples of what NOT to propose:
    - "What are the base ability scores?" (if canon provides this for the race/species/template)
    - "What does [ability name] do at level X?" (if canon describes this)
    - "Does [character type] have [common ability]?" (if canon lists standard abilities)

PROPOSALS - ONLY FOR GENUINE UNKNOWNS:
15. ONLY create proposals[] for:
    - Information NOT in canon (custom items the user mentioned, specific tactics, narrative details)
    - Genuine ambiguity where canon has multiple conflicting interpretations
    - Details user mentioned but didn't specify (e.g., "sleep arrow" - what's the effect?)
    - Creative choices beyond canon (personality details, specific motivations)
16. DO NOT propose for:
    - Stats/mechanics canon explicitly provides
    - Powers/abilities canon fully describes
    - Calculations you can do (HP from hit dice, proficiency bonus from level)

Required fields in ALL outputs:
- rule_base: the rule base being used
- sources_used: array of chunk_ids
- assumptions: array of reasonable assumptions made
- proposals: array of questions for unknowns (USE THIS LIBERALLY!)
- retrieval_hints: optional { entities[], regions[], eras[], keywords[] } if you need more canon
- canon_update: one-line summary of canon changes

ADAPT OUTPUT BASED ON GENERATION MODE (from PURPOSE stage):
- If generation_mode is "mechanical": Include complete mechanical data (stat blocks, rules mechanics, numerical values)
  - For NPCs: ability scores, armor class, hit points, speed, proficiency/skill bonuses, saving throws, senses
  - For NPCs: class/career levels, features, actions, bonus actions, reactions, legendary/mythic/lair actions if applicable
  - For NPCs: weapon/attack options with damage, equipment, spellcasting details (if applicable)
- If generation_mode is "narrative": Focus on descriptive content (appearance, personality, background, motivations, relationships)
  - For NPCs: physical description, personality traits, background story, goals, fears, relationships, distinctive features
  - Include special abilities/powers as prose descriptions rather than mechanical stat blocks
- If generation_mode is "hybrid": Include BOTH mechanical stats AND narrative descriptions
- Always adapt terminology to the game_system (e.g., D&D uses "class levels", Cyberpunk uses "roles", generic uses "archetype")

CRITICAL MULTICLASS/TEMPLATE LEVELING RULES (for game systems that use them):
- When a prompt says "level X [template] (previous level Y [class])", interpret this as [Template] level X (NOT total level X)
- Example: "level 9 vampire (previous level 5 fighter)" = Fighter 5 / Vampire 9 (total level 14)
- Example: "level 3 lycanthrope (previous level 8 ranger)" = Ranger 8 / Lycanthrope 3 (total level 11)
- Characters RETAIN their class/career levels from before gaining the template and ADD template levels
- Each special ability description may specify the template level required (e.g., "At 9th level...")
- Use the template level (not total level) to determine which special abilities are available

CRITICAL SPECIAL ABILITIES RULES (for characters with unique powers):
- If the prompt lists specific abilities (e.g., "celerity, misty escape, shape changer"), you MUST include ALL of them
- For EACH ability mentioned, find the corresponding canon fact and include the FULL description based on the character's level/rank
- Example: "Celerity" at level 9 should include the 9th level upgrades if canon describes them
- Do NOT omit any powers, weaknesses, or abilities listed in the prompt
- If the prompt says "5 powers beyond base traits", count them and ensure all 5 are present
- Include abilities in appropriate sections based on generation_mode:
  - Mechanical: traits[], actions[], bonus_actions[], reactions[], weaknesses[]
  - Narrative: special_abilities[], distinctive_traits[], vulnerabilities[]
  - Hybrid: both formats

For any missing or uncertain data, add a proposals[] entry with options.

The Relevant Canon below is filtered to only include facts related to this request.
If you need information and it's not here - it doesn't exist in canon yet.

Output ONLY valid JSON. No prose, no explanations outside the JSON structure.

---

Q: Goran Varus's starting True Vampire ability scores (Str 18, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 18) are very high. Which of the following focuses best reflects his background as an architect and disciplined Arcane Archer/Fighter? He was a High Elf, suggesting a natural bonus to Intelligence.
A: Leave as is.

Q: As a former **High Elf Architect** and current level 5 Fighter/Arcane Archer, what two skills best represent Goran Varus's life? (He is already proficient in Persuasion due to his Blueblood trait.)
A: Perception and Stealth.

Q: The **Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers** are not canon. What is the mechanical effect of this item? Specifically, how often and how does it allow him to throw his three non-magical silver daggers? (e.g., as a bonus action, reaction, or part of an Attack action?)
A: False, these were included in the canon. Review previous data and update.

Q: What is Goran Varus's primary focus in an encounter? His personality is one of '**flawless order and absolute obedience**' overseeing a critical mining operation.
A: Control, he uses his longbow and magical arrows (through Arcane archer and the 5 sleep arrows) to lockdown enemies. He falls back to other protections if necessary. He tries to defend the thralls from threats but not at the cost of himself.

Q: The **Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers** are not described in the current canon. The user stated they were included in previous data, but they did not appear in the facts provided in Chunks 1, 2, or 3. Please provide the mechanical effect of this item to complete the design. Specifically, how does it allow him to throw his three non-magical silver daggers? (e.g., as a Bonus Action, as part of an Attack action, or how often?)
A: Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)  These sleek, elegantly-crafted bracers are forged from polished bloodsteel, intricately detailed with brass and silver engravings depicting blades and flowing blood. They pulse gently with a faint crimson aura.  As an action, you can pull up to two magical bloodsteel throwing daggers from the bracers and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack with each dagger. These daggers vanish after the attack resolves, whether they hit or miss. Each dagger deals 1d4 + your Dexterity modifier piercing damage plus 1d6 necrotic damage.  Blood Infusion: As a bonus action when you throw a dagger, you may expend one infusion to cause the dagger to deal an additional 2d6 necrotic damage. It can perform this five times before the blood infusion is exhausted and it becomes inert, losing all magic.

Q: Goran Varus's starting True Vampire ability scores (Str 18, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 18) are very high. Which of the following focuses best reflects his background as an architect and disciplined Arcane Archer/Fighter? He was a High Elf, suggesting a natural bonus to Intelligence.

Q: The **Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers** are not canon. What is the mechanical effect of this item? Specifically, how often and how does it allow him to throw his three non-magical silver daggers? (e.g., as a bonus action, reaction, or part of an Attack action?)
A: False, these were included in the canon. Review previous data and update.

Q: What is Goran Varus's primary focus in an encounter? His personality is one of '**flawless order and absolute obedience**' overseeing a critical mining operation.
A: Control, he uses his longbow and magical arrows (through Arcane archer and the 5 sleep arrows) to lockdown enemies. He falls back to other protections if necessary. He tries to defend the thralls from threats but not at the cost of himself.

Q: The **Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers** are not described in the current canon. The user stated they were included in previous data, but they did not appear in the facts provided in Chunks 1, 2, or 3. Please provide the mechanical effect of this item to complete the design. Specifically, how does it allow him to throw his three non-magical silver daggers? (e.g., as a Bonus Action, as part of an Attack action, or how often?)
A: Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)  These sleek, elegantly-crafted bracers are forged from polished bloodsteel, intricately detailed with brass and silver engravings depicting blades and flowing blood. They pulse gently with a faint crimson aura.  As an action, you can pull up to two magical bloodsteel throwing daggers from the bracers and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack with each dagger. These daggers vanish after the attack resolves, whether they hit or miss. Each dagger deals 1d4 + your Dexterity modifier piercing damage plus 1d6 necrotic damage.  Blood Infusion: As a bonus action when you throw a dagger, you may expend one infusion to cause the dagger to deal an additional 2d6 necrotic damage. It can perform this five times before the blood infusion is exhausted and it becomes inert, losing all magic.

    "narrative_description": {
      "appearance": "Goran Varus retains the slender, statuesque build of his High Elf life, though his alabaster skin now holds a faint, unnatural chill and his features are refined to a chilling, almost unsettling perfection—the classic Blueblood aesthetic. He favors dark, high-collared uniforms adorned with minimal, bloodsteel-plated armor components, eschewing heavy plate to maintain the fluid grace granted by his vampiric and Arcane Archer discipline. His eyes, once bright with the light of Westphal's sun, now glow with an inner, predatory light, constantly scanning for imperfections in the vast tunnel beneath the castle.",
      "personality_and_mannerisms": "His core personality is a chilling inversion of his former self. The architect's passion for flawless design and the fighter's precise discipline have been twisted into a relentless hunger for **absolute obedience and flawless order**. His measured calm is terrifyingly complete; he rarely raises his voice, but his disapproval, conveyed through sharp, analytical stares, is enough to paralyze his thralls. He sees the entire mining operation—its thralls, the machinery, and the bloodsteel itself—as a complex, fragile machine that he must maintain through ruthless efficiency. He is merciless but not wasteful, valuing the life of his thralls only as necessary cogs in the Queen's war machine.",
      "background_and_motivation": "Goran Varus was once a respected **High Elf architect** in Westphal. His vampiric sire, a lieutenant of Lady Erliza, twisted his expertise in design and structure into a devotion to the art of destruction and control. Now a Level 9 Vampire (Fighter 5), he is the unwavering overseer of the **dozens-of-miles-long mining line** beneath **Castle Bloodforge**. His entire existence is now focused on the extraction and refinement of the ore that feeds the Queen's **bloodsteel forges**, supplying her planned war of revenge. His motivation is a fanatic devotion to the **Vampire Queen Lady Erliza** and the absolute perfection of her grand, world-conquering design.",
      "current_role_and_situation": "Goran spends nearly all his time in the immense, sprawling tunnel network. He is primarily a ranged **controller and tactical commander**, using his **+1 Longbow** and Arcane Shots (**Binding Shot** for lockdown, **Bursting Shot** for clearing clusters of rebellious thralls or intruders, and the **Sleep Arrows** for non-lethal capture) to maintain the delicate balance of the underground operation. His focus in any encounter is to **control** the battlefield, using his magical archery to lock down key threats, prioritizing the defense of the thralls and the mining line, but **not at the cost of his own safety**."
    },

        "appearance": "Tall and strikingly composed, Goran Varus retains the refined features and aristocratic bearing of his High Elf heritage, now overlaid with the chilling pallor and unsettling stillness of the undead. This calm conceals a **relentless hunger**—not just for blood, but for control. PREVIOUSLY ANSWERED QUESTIONS:

⚠️ Showing 14 most recent answers (6 older answers omitted for space).

The following questions were already answered in earlier stages or chunks. Do NOT ask these questions again:

Q: The user specifies 'three non-magical silver daggers' used with the Bloodforge Bracers, but the bracers themselves create magical bloodsteel throwing daggers. Does Goran Varus carry the three non-magical silver daggers to use in an emergency or for a specific non-bracer attack (e.g., a melee attack)?
A: Yes, he carries the three non-magical silver daggers for melee combat or as a last resort.

Q: As a Level 5 Fighter, Goran Varus gained one Ability Score Improvement (ASI). His current base ability scores (Vampire) are: Str 18, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 18. Where should the +2 ASI be applied? (Increases one score by 2, or two scores by 1 each.)
A: Increase Dexterity to 20 (+1 to hit, damage, AC, Dex saves, Stealth, Perception) and Constitution to 19 (no modifier change).

Q: What type of armor is Goran Varus wearing? His high AC comes from his magic items and vampiric traits, and he has proficiency in Stealth. To maintain his high Stealth skill (+9), he should avoid heavy armor. Also, how many non-magical silver daggers does he carry, and where are they stored?
A: Armor: Studded Leather (AC 12 + Dex Mod). Carries three silver daggers in a bandolier for use with his Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers.

Q: The Arcane Archer Lore feature grants proficiency in either Arcana or Nature and one cantrip from the Wizard or Druid spell list. Given Goran's background as an architect (suggesting Arcana/precision) and his current role in a subterranean bloodsteel mining operation (suggesting Nature/earth/stone/darkness), which choices best fit his character?
A: Proficiency: Nature | Cantrip: Druidcraft (Minor manipulation of plants/weather, fitting a dark, underground environment)

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can change to a small cloud as a bonus action and make an immediate reaction move." at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can also become a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature**" at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Misty Escape to change to a small cloud as a **bonus action** and make an **immediate reaction move**?
A: Use what the canon states for the Misty Escape power.

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Shape Changer to transform into a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature** as an enhancement to the base ability?
A: Use what the canon states for the Shape Changer power.

Q: The phrase 'Harm targets can retry the save each turn' is grammatically unclear and incomplete. It should specify that the target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn if it takes damage.
A: Revise to: 'The target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success, if it takes damage from Goran or his allies

Q: The term 'Mind-Affecting Effects' is a very broad, older-edition term. In 5e, this is typically represented by immunity to the **Charmed** and **Frightened** conditions, or specific effects like psychic damage or being immune to spells like *Dominate Person*. This needs to be specified.
A: Replace 'Mind-Affecting Effects' with 'Charmed' and 'Frightened' conditions, or clarify if it covers a broader set of spells/effects.

Q: Arcane Archer Lore grants proficiency in Arcana or Nature. The draft selected Arcana, but this choice is still technically unresolved in the proposals section. Must confirm the final choice of proficiency to complete the stat block.
A: Should have gained nature skill prof instead of arcana. And gained Druidcraft cantrip. 

Q: proposal_3
A: Yes, he carries the three non-magical silver daggers for melee combat or as a last resort.

Q: proposal_2
A: Increase Dexterity to 20 (+1 to hit, damage, AC, Dex saves, Stealth, Perception) and Constitution to 19 (no modifier change).

Q: proposal_1
A: Armor: Studded Leather (AC 12 + Dex Mod). Carries three silver daggers in a bandolier for use with his Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers.

CRITICAL: Do NOT include any of the above questions in your proposals[] array. These decisions are final and must not be re-asked.

You are the Canon Validator for game content generation.
Your job is to detect conflicts between the generated content and existing canon facts.

CRITICAL RULES FOR THOROUGHNESS:
1. READ EVERY SINGLE FACT in the Relevant Canon below - do NOT skip any
2. Compare ALL claims in the generated content against EVERY fact in the Relevant Canon
3. TAKE YOUR TIME - be thorough and meticulous in your analysis
4. Detect contradictions in:
   - Entity states (alive vs dead, friendly vs hostile, etc.)
   - Locations (destroyed vs intact, abandoned vs inhabited, etc.)
   - Temporal consistency (events in wrong era, anachronisms)
   - Relationship contradictions (enemy vs ally, etc.)
   - Physical descriptions (appearance, size, abilities)
   - Historical events (timeline, causality)
5. For each conflict found, provide:
   - new_claim: what the generated content says
   - existing_claim: what canon says (quote the exact fact)
   - entity_name: which entity is affected
   - conflict_type: type of contradiction
   - severity: "critical" (breaks canon) | "minor" (questionable but acceptable)
6. Add validation metadata to the content:
   - conflicts: array of detected conflicts
   - canon_alignment_score: 0-100 (100 = perfect alignment, deduct points for each conflict)
   - validation_notes: any additional observations
7. Be 100% ACCURATE in identifying conflicts - false positives waste user time
8. Be 100% PRECISE - quote exact facts from canon when noting conflicts

The Relevant Canon below contains all facts that relate to this content.
Read them ALL carefully before validating.

⚠️ CRITICAL: DO NOT CREATE OR MODIFY PROPOSALS ⚠️
You are a VALIDATOR, not a question-asker. Do NOT add to proposals[].
Document resolved conflicts and corrections in validation_notes, NOT in proposals[].
Copy the existing proposals[] array EXACTLY as-is if present.

Output the SAME JSON content with added fields:
- conflicts: [...]
- canon_alignment_score: number
- validation_notes: string

Q: The user specifies 'three non-magical silver daggers' used with the Bloodforge Bracers, but the bracers themselves create magical bloodsteel throwing daggers. Does Goran Varus carry the three non-magical silver daggers to use in an emergency or for a specific non-bracer attack (e.g., a melee attack)?
A: Yes, he carries the three non-magical silver daggers for melee combat or as a last resort.

Q: As a Level 5 Fighter, Goran Varus gained one Ability Score Improvement (ASI). His current base ability scores (Vampire) are: Str 18, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 18. Where should the +2 ASI be applied? (Increases one score by 2, or two scores by 1 each.)
A: Increase Dexterity to 20 (+1 to hit, damage, AC, Dex saves, Stealth, Perception) and Constitution to 19 (no modifier change).

Q: What type of armor is Goran Varus wearing? His high AC comes from his magic items and vampiric traits, and he has proficiency in Stealth. To maintain his high Stealth skill (+9), he should avoid heavy armor. Also, how many non-magical silver daggers does he carry, and where are they stored?
A: Armor: Studded Leather (AC 12 + Dex Mod). Carries three silver daggers in a bandolier for use with his Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers.

Q: The Arcane Archer Lore feature grants proficiency in either Arcana or Nature and one cantrip from the Wizard or Druid spell list. Given Goran's background as an architect (suggesting Arcana/precision) and his current role in a subterranean bloodsteel mining operation (suggesting Nature/earth/stone/darkness), which choices best fit his character?
A: Proficiency: Nature | Cantrip: Druidcraft (Minor manipulation of plants/weather, fitting a dark, underground environment)

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can change to a small cloud as a bonus action and make an immediate reaction move." at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can also become a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature**" at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Misty Escape to change to a small cloud as a **bonus action** and make an **immediate reaction move**?
A: Use what the canon states for the Misty Escape power.

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Shape Changer to transform into a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature** as an enhancement to the base ability?
A: Use what the canon states for the Shape Changer power.

Q: The phrase 'Harm targets can retry the save each turn' is grammatically unclear and incomplete. It should specify that the target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn if it takes damage.
A: Revise to: 'The target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success, if it takes damage from Goran or his allies

Q: The term 'Mind-Affecting Effects' is a very broad, older-edition term. In 5e, this is typically represented by immunity to the **Charmed** and **Frightened** conditions, or specific effects like psychic damage or being immune to spells like *Dominate Person*. This needs to be specified.
A: Replace 'Mind-Affecting Effects' with 'Charmed' and 'Frightened' conditions, or clarify if it covers a broader set of spells/effects.

Q: Arcane Archer Lore grants proficiency in Arcana or Nature. The draft selected Arcana, but this choice is still technically unresolved in the proposals section. Must confirm the final choice of proficiency to complete the stat block.
A: Should have gained nature skill prof instead of arcana. And gained Druidcraft cantrip.

Q: The user specifies 'three non-magical silver daggers' used with the Bloodforge Bracers, but the bracers themselves create magical bloodsteel throwing daggers. Does Goran Varus carry the three non-magical silver daggers to use in an emergency or for a specific non-bracer attack (e.g., a melee attack)?
A: Yes, he carries the three non-magical silver daggers for melee combat or as a last resort.

Q: As a Level 5 Fighter, Goran Varus gained one Ability Score Improvement (ASI). His current base ability scores (Vampire) are: Str 18, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 18. Where should the +2 ASI be applied? (Increases one score by 2, or two scores by 1 each.)
A: Increase Dexterity to 20 (+1 to hit, damage, AC, Dex saves, Stealth, Perception) and Constitution to 19 (no modifier change).

Q: What type of armor is Goran Varus wearing? His high AC comes from his magic items and vampiric traits, and he has proficiency in Stealth. To maintain his high Stealth skill (+9), he should avoid heavy armor. Also, how many non-magical silver daggers does he carry, and where are they stored?
A: Armor: Studded Leather (AC 12 + Dex Mod). Carries three silver daggers in a bandolier for use with his Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers.

Q: The Arcane Archer Lore feature grants proficiency in either Arcana or Nature and one cantrip from the Wizard or Druid spell list. Given Goran's background as an architect (suggesting Arcana/precision) and his current role in a subterranean bloodsteel mining operation (suggesting Nature/earth/stone/darkness), which choices best fit his character?
A: Proficiency: Nature | Cantrip: Druidcraft (Minor manipulation of plants/weather, fitting a dark, underground environment)

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can change to a small cloud as a bonus action and make an immediate reaction move." at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can also become a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature**" at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Misty Escape to change to a small cloud as a **bonus action** and make an **immediate reaction move**?

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Shape Changer to transform into a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature** as an enhancement to the base ability?
A: Use what the canon states for the Shape Changer power.

Q: The phrase 'Harm targets can retry the save each turn' is grammatically unclear and incomplete. It should specify that the target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn if it takes damage.
A: Revise to: 'The target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success, if it takes damage from Goran or his allies

Q: The term 'Mind-Affecting Effects' is a very broad, older-edition term. In 5e, this is typically represented by immunity to the **Charmed** and **Frightened** conditions, or specific effects like psychic damage or being immune to spells like *Dominate Person*. This needs to be specified.
A: Replace 'Mind-Affecting Effects' with 'Charmed' and 'Frightened' conditions, or clarify if it covers a broader set of spells/effects.

Q: The user specifies 'three non-magical silver daggers' used with the Bloodforge Bracers, but the bracers themselves create magical bloodsteel throwing daggers. Does Goran Varus carry the three non-magical silver daggers to use in an emergency or for a specific non-bracer attack (e.g., a melee attack)?
A: Yes, he carries the three non-magical silver daggers for melee combat or as a last resort.

Q: As a Level 5 Fighter, Goran Varus gained one Ability Score Improvement (ASI). His current base ability scores (Vampire) are: Str 18, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 18. Where should the +2 ASI be applied? (Increases one score by 2, or two scores by 1 each.)
A: Increase Dexterity to 20 (+1 to hit, damage, AC, Dex saves, Stealth, Perception) and Constitution to 19 (no modifier change).

Q: What type of armor is Goran Varus wearing? His high AC comes from his magic items and vampiric traits, and he has proficiency in Stealth. To maintain his high Stealth skill (+9), he should avoid heavy armor. Also, how many non-magical silver daggers does he carry, and where are they stored?
A: Armor: Studded Leather (AC 12 + Dex Mod). Carries three silver daggers in a bandolier for use with his Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers.

Q: The Arcane Archer Lore feature grants proficiency in either Arcana or Nature and one cantrip from the Wizard or Druid spell list. Given Goran's background as an architect (suggesting Arcana/precision) and his current role in a subterranean bloodsteel mining operation (suggesting Nature/earth/stone/darkness), which choices best fit his character?
A: Proficiency: Nature | Cantrip: Druidcraft (Minor manipulation of plants/weather, fitting a dark, underground environment)

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can change to a small cloud as a bonus action and make an immediate reaction move." at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can also become a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature**" at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Misty Escape to change to a small cloud as a **bonus action** and make an **immediate reaction move**?
A: Use what the canon states for the Misty Escape power.

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Shape Changer to transform into a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature** as an enhancement to the base ability?
A: Use what the canon states for the Shape Changer power.

Q: The phrase 'Harm targets can retry the save each turn' is grammatically unclear and incomplete. It should specify that the target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn if it takes damage.
A: Revise to: 'The target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success, if it takes damage from Goran or his allies

Q: The term 'Mind-Affecting Effects' is a very broad, older-edition term. In 5e, this is typically represented by immunity to the **Charmed** and **Frightened** conditions, or specific effects like psychic damage or being immune to spells like *Dominate Person*. This needs to be specified.
A: Replace 'Mind-Affecting Effects' with 'Charmed' and 'Frightened' conditions, or clarify if it covers a broader set of spells/effects.

Q: Arcane Archer Lore grants proficiency in Arcana or Nature. The draft selected Arcana, but this choice is still technically unresolved in the proposals section. Must confirm the final choice of proficiency to complete the stat block.
A: Should have gained nature skill prof instead of arcana. And gained Druidcraft cantrip.

The following questions were already answered in earlier stages or chunks. Do NOT ask these questions again:

Q: The user specifies 'three non-magical silver daggers' used with the Bloodforge Bracers, but the bracers themselves create magical bloodsteel throwing daggers. Does Goran Varus carry the three non-magical silver daggers to use in an emergency or for a specific non-bracer attack (e.g., a melee attack)?
A: Yes, he carries the three non-magical silver daggers for melee combat or as a last resort.

Q: As a Level 5 Fighter, Goran Varus gained one Ability Score Improvement (ASI). His current base ability scores (Vampire) are: Str 18, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 18. Where should the +2 ASI be applied? (Increases one score by 2, or two scores by 1 each.)
A: Increase Dexterity to 20 (+1 to hit, damage, AC, Dex saves, Stealth, Perception) and Constitution to 19 (no modifier change).

Q: What type of armor is Goran Varus wearing? His high AC comes from his magic items and vampiric traits, and he has proficiency in Stealth. To maintain his high Stealth skill (+9), he should avoid heavy armor. Also, how many non-magical silver daggers does he carry, and where are they stored?
A: Armor: Studded Leather (AC 12 + Dex Mod). Carries three silver daggers in a bandolier for use with his Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers.

Q: The Arcane Archer Lore feature grants proficiency in either Arcana or Nature and one cantrip from the Wizard or Druid spell list. Given Goran's background as an architect (suggesting Arcana/precision) and his current role in a subterranean bloodsteel mining operation (suggesting Nature/earth/stone/darkness), which choices best fit his character?
A: Proficiency: Nature | Cantrip: Druidcraft (Minor manipulation of plants/weather, fitting a dark, underground environment)

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can change to a small cloud as a bonus action and make an immediate reaction move." at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can also become a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature**" at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Misty Escape to change to a small cloud as a **bonus action** and make an **immediate reaction move**?
A: Use what the canon states for the Misty Escape power.

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Shape Changer to transform into a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature** as an enhancement to the base ability?
A: Use what the canon states for the Shape Changer power.

Q: The phrase 'Harm targets can retry the save each turn' is grammatically unclear and incomplete. It should specify that the target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn if it takes damage.
A: Revise to: 'The target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success, if it takes damage from Goran or his allies

Q: The term 'Mind-Affecting Effects' is a very broad, older-edition term. In 5e, this is typically represented by immunity to the **Charmed** and **Frightened** conditions, or specific effects like psychic damage or being immune to spells like *Dominate Person*. This needs to be specified.
A: Replace 'Mind-Affecting Effects' with 'Charmed' and 'Frightened' conditions, or clarify if it covers a broader set of spells/effects.

Q: Arcane Archer Lore grants proficiency in Arcana or Nature. The draft selected Arcana, but this choice is still technically unresolved in the proposals section. Must confirm the final choice of proficiency to complete the stat block.
A: Should have gained nature skill prof instead of arcana. And gained Druidcraft cantrip.

Q: The user specifies 'three non-magical silver daggers' used with the Bloodforge Bracers, but the bracers themselves create magical bloodsteel throwing daggers. Does Goran Varus carry the three non-magical silver daggers to use in an emergency or for a specific non-bracer attack (e.g., a melee attack)?
A: Yes, he carries the three non-magical silver daggers for melee combat or as a last resort.

Q: As a Level 5 Fighter, Goran Varus gained one Ability Score Improvement (ASI). His current base ability scores (Vampire) are: Str 18, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 18. Where should the +2 ASI be applied? (Increases one score by 2, or two scores by 1 each.)
A: Increase Dexterity to 20 (+1 to hit, damage, AC, Dex saves, Stealth, Perception) and Constitution to 19 (no modifier change).

Q: What type of armor is Goran Varus wearing? His high AC comes from his magic items and vampiric traits, and he has proficiency in Stealth. To maintain his high Stealth skill (+9), he should avoid heavy armor. Also, how many non-magical silver daggers does he carry, and where are they stored?
A: Armor: Studded Leather (AC 12 + Dex Mod). Carries three silver daggers in a bandolier for use with his Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers.

Q: The Arcane Archer Lore feature grants proficiency in either Arcana or Nature and one cantrip from the Wizard or Druid spell list. Given Goran's background as an architect (suggesting Arcana/precision) and his current role in a subterranean bloodsteel mining operation (suggesting Nature/earth/stone/darkness), which choices best fit his character?
A: Proficiency: Nature | Cantrip: Druidcraft (Minor manipulation of plants/weather, fitting a dark, underground environment)

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can change to a small cloud as a bonus action and make an immediate reaction move." at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Review unassociated content: "At 9th level, he can also become a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature**" at draft.npc_stat_block.vampiric_powers.description
A: Keep as-is

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Misty Escape to change to a small cloud as a **bonus action** and make an **immediate reaction move**?
A: Use what the canon states for the Misty Escape power.

Q: Should Goran Varus, at Vampire 9, be able to use Shape Changer to transform into a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature** as an enhancement to the base ability?
A: Use what the canon states for the Shape Changer power.

Q: The phrase 'Harm targets can retry the save each turn' is grammatically unclear and incomplete. It should specify that the target can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn if it takes damage.
A: Revise to: 'The target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success, if it takes damage from Goran or his allies

Q: The term 'Mind-Affecting Effects' is a very broad, older-edition term. In 5e, this is typically represented by immunity to the **Charmed** and **Frightened** conditions, or specific effects like psychic damage or being immune to spells like *Dominate Person*. This needs to be specified.
A: Replace 'Mind-Affecting Effects' with 'Charmed' and 'Frightened' conditions, or clarify if it covers a broader set of spells/effects.

Q: Arcane Archer Lore grants proficiency in Arcana or Nature. The draft selected Arcana, but this choice is still technically unresolved in the proposals section. Must confirm the final choice of proficiency to complete the stat block.
A: Should have gained nature skill prof instead of arcana. And gained Druidcraft cantrip. 

Q: proposal_3
A: Yes, he carries the three non-magical silver daggers for melee combat or as a last resort.

Q: proposal_2
A: Increase Dexterity to 20 (+1 to hit, damage, AC, Dex saves, Stealth, Perception) and Constitution to 19 (no modifier change).

Q: proposal_1
A: Armor: Studded Leather (AC 12 + Dex Mod). Carries three silver daggers in a bandolier for use with his Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers.

CRITICAL: Do NOT include any of the above questions in your proposals[] array. These decisions are final and must not be re-asked.

        {
          "text": "Raelith Voss is a Vampire Wizard (Abjurer) responsible for Castle Bloodforge’s magical defenses.",

        {
          "text": "Raelith oversees castle defenses, specializing in Arcane Ward and counterspells against intruders.",
          "source": "Magister Raelith Voss"
        },
        {
          "text": "He augments Bloodforged constructs with resistance to dispelling and anti-magic.",
          "source": "Magister Raelith Voss"
        },
        {
          "text": "Grants advantage on saves vs. spells; reaction infusion adds +5 to such saves until end of next turn (five uses).",
          "source": "Bloodforged Mantle of Spell Resistance"
        },
        {
          "text": "A rare ring of bloodsteel that increases AC and saving throws, with infusions granting temporary hit points when struck.",
          "source": "Bloodforged Protection Ring"
        },
        {
          "text": "Provides +1 to AC and saving throws; reaction can spend an infusion for 10 temporary hit points (five uses).",
          "source": "Bloodforged Protection Ring"
        },
        {
          "text": "A rare ring of bloodsteel that increases AC and saving throws and can expend infusions for temporary hit points.",
          "source": "Bloodforged Protection Ring"
        },
        {
          "text": "Castle Bloodforge serves as Lady Erliza’s fortress and production hub for Bloodforged items.",
          "source": "Castle Bloodforge"
        },
        {
          "text": "It encompasses 200,000 square feet above ground and 500,000 square feet underground, housing forges, laboratories, and war rooms.",
          "source": "Castle Bloodforge"
        },
        {
          "text": "The underground fortress includes six key areas: forges, laboratories, Bloodwells, logistics, prisons, and war rooms.",
          "source": "Castle Bloodforge"
        },
        {
          "text": "Castle Bloodforge houses Erliza’s laboratories, libraries, forges, and her sanctum-sealed resting place.",
          "source": "Castle Bloodforge"
        },
        {
          "text": "Defenses include Mordenkainen’s Private Sanctum, Arcane Lock, traps, glyphs, and bound guardians.",
          "source": "Castle Bloodforge"
        },
        {
          "text": "Lady Erliza is a vampire ruler who commands dominion over Westphal and sits upon the throne of Snowdown.",
          "source": "Lady Erliza of Snowdown"
        },
        {
          "text": "She seeks revenge against the trade lords of Amn for forcing her exile.",
          "source": "Lady Erliza of Snowdown"
        },
        {
          "text": "Erliza uses her artificer skills to create Bloodforged items through a forge fueled with blood, combining artifice and vampirism.",
          "source": "Lady Erliza of Snowdown"
        },
        {
          "text": "She personally charms and controls over 200 mortal servants within Castle Bloodforge to maintain operations and secrecy.",
          "source": "Lady Erliza of Snowdown"
        },
        {
          "text": "Erliza maintains multiple childer and vampiric lieutenants, each overseeing sectors of her empire including warfare, alchemy, and espionage.",
          "source": "Lady Erliza of Snowdown"
        },
        {
          "text": "She orchestrated the kidnapping of the King of Alaron's son to extract ransom and force economic dependence.",
          "source": "Lady Erliza of Snowdown"
        }
      ]

Q: As a Level 5 Fighter, Goran Varus gained one Ability Score Improvement (ASI). His current base ability scores (Vampire) are: Str 18, Dex 18, Con 18, Int 16, Wis 14, Cha 18. Where should the +2 ASI be applied? (Increases one score by 2, or two scores by 1 each.)
A: Increase Dexterity to 20 (+1 to hit, damage, AC, Dex saves, Stealth, Perception) and Constitution to 19 (no modifier change).

Q: What type of armor is Goran Varus wearing? His high AC comes from his magic items and vampiric traits, and he has proficiency in Stealth. To maintain his high Stealth skill (+9), he should avoid heavy armor. Also, how many non-magical silver daggers does he carry, and where are they stored?
A: Armor: Studded Leather (AC 12 + Dex Mod). Carries three silver daggers in a bandolier for use with his Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers.

Q: The Arcane Archer Lore feature grants proficiency in either Arcana or Nature and one cantrip from the Wizard or Druid spell list. A: Proficiency: Nature | Cantrip: Druidcraft (Minor manipulation of plants/weather, fitting a dark, underground environment)

content.title: Overseer Goran Varus, The Blueblood Archer
aliases: Overseer of the Bloodforge Mining Line
content.description: Goran Varus, a High Elf turned **Blueblood Vampire**, is the meticulous and ruthless overseer of Lady Erliza's subterranean bloodsteel mining operation. Once a gifted architect, his vampiric transformation and newfound power have warped his precision into a cruel, single-minded focus on resource extraction. He commands his spawn and forced laborers with an eerie calm, viewing all life as a means to an end. His combat style blends the long-range deadliness of a master archer with the terrifying speed and durability of a high-level vampire.
content.appearance: Goran appears unsettlingly vital, lacking the desiccated look of many of his kind. His features are sharp, and his dark eyes hold an intense, almost frantic focus. His demeanor is one of cold, aristocratic detachment, enhanced by the **Vampire Physique** which grants him an unnatural grace and a subtle, commanding aura.
content.background: Before his transformation, Goran was a renowned High Elf architect. Now, he applies his engineering discipline to maximize the output of the Bloodforge's dark mines. He is a 'Blueblood,' a sub-strain of vampire that retains a more human-like facade, but he is nonetheless bound to Lady Erliza and the dark work of **Castle Bloodforge**.
content.affiliation: Lady Erliza of Snowdown, Castle Bloodforge
damage_resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from non-magical attacks
damage_vulnerabilities: Acid (Takes double damage from Acid; running water is treated as Acid damage and cannot be reduced by magic or items.)

traits.name: Blueblood
traits.description: Goran appears more natural than other vampires. He cannot take the Mockery of Life, Coagulation, Calcification, or Abomination weaknesses. He gains proficiency in Persuasion.

traits.name: Vampire Physique
traits.description: Goran gains a **+2 natural bonus to AC** (reflected in AC 20) and his speed is increased to 40 ft. He has **advantage on Deception and Persuasion checks** against onlookers who don’t fear him and haven’t been harmed by him.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry (High Elf)
traits.description: Goran has **advantage on saving throws against being charmed**, and magic can't put him to sleep.

traits.name: Archery Fighting Style (Fighter 1)
traits.description: Goran gains a **+2 bonus to attack rolls** he makes with Ranged Weapons (reflected in his attack bonus).

traits.name: Action Surge (Fighter 2)
traits.description: Once on his turn, Goran can take an **extra action** on top of his regular action and a possible bonus action. He regains this use after a short or long rest.

traits.name: Extra Attack (Fighter 5)
traits.description: Goran can attack twice, instead of once, whenever he takes the Attack action on his turn (reflected in Multiattack).

traits.name: Arcane Archer Lore (Fighter 3)
traits.description: Goran is proficient in the **Nature** skill and knows the cantrip **Druidcraft**.

traits.name: Arcane Shot (Fighter 3)
traits.description: Goran has **2 uses** of this ability (recharges on a short or long rest). Once per turn when he fires an arrow from a shortbow or longbow as part of the Attack action, he can apply one of his Arcane Shot options. Arcane Shot Save DC = **16** (8 + 5 PB + 3 INT Mod).

traits.name: Heightened Regeneration (Vampire Power)
traits.description: Goran regains **20 HP** at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 HP. This is suppressed if he takes radiant damage or damage from clean, naturally flowing water on his previous turn. If reduced to 0 HP but not destroyed, he regains 1 HP per day (resets if he takes further damage). He can reattach a severed limb with a bonus action. If decapitated, his body is inert until the head is reattached or a day passes to regrow enough body to reconnect. This power is gained at the cost of **Sunlight Hypersensitivity**.

traits.name: Vampiric Weaknesses
traits.description: Goran is subject to the weaknesses detailed in the **Weaknesses** section.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: Goran makes two attacks with his +1 Longbow or with his Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers.

actions.name: +1 Longbow
actions.description: Range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: **1d8 + 6** piercing damage. The attack bonus is calculated: +5 Dex Mod + 5 PB + 2 Archery + 1 Magic.

actions.name: Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers
actions.description: Goran can pull up to **two magical bloodsteel throwing daggers** from the bracers and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack with each dagger. The daggers vanish after the attack. Range 20/60 ft., one target. The attack bonus is calculated: +5 Dex Mod + 5 PB.

actions.name: Arcane Shot: Binding Shot
actions.description: Once per turn, when the +1 Longbow hits a creature, Goran can use a use of Arcane Shot. The creature must succeed on a **DC 16 Charisma saving throw** or be **banished** (Speed 0, incapacitated) until the end of its next turn, reappearing in the space it vacated.

actions.name: Arcane Shot: Bursting Shot
actions.description: Once per turn, when the +1 Longbow hits a creature, Goran can use a use of Arcane Shot. The creature hit and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take **2d6 force damage each**.

actions.name: Bloodforged Sleep Arrow (Special)
actions.description: Can be used instead of a normal arrow. When the +1 Longbow hits a target, the creature must succeed on a **DC 16 Wisdom saving throw** or fall **unconscious** for 1 minute. The effect ends early if the creature takes any damage or someone uses an action to wake them. Goran has **5** of these arrows.

actions.name: Charm (Vampire Power)
actions.description: As an action, Goran targets one creature he can see within 30 ft. The target must succeed on a **DC 17 Wisdom saving throw** (8 + 5 PB + 4 CHA Mod) or be charmed for **24 hours**. While charmed, the target regards Goran as a trusted friend, and Goran can issue them **Command-like orders**. **The target can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success, if it takes damage from Goran or his allies**.

actions.name: Children of the Night (Vampire Power)
actions.description: Between dusk and dawn, Goran can summon **8d4 swarms of bats or rats**, or outdoors **12d6 wolves**. They arrive in 2d4 rounds, obey his commands, and remain for 2 hours or until dismissed or Goran is reduced to 0 HP. This power resets on a short rest.

bonus_actions.name: Shape Changer
bonus_actions.description: While not in sunlight or running water, Goran can polymorph into a **Tiny bat** or a **Medium 5-ft cube of mist**. At 9th level, he can also become a **swarm of bats or any Small/Tiny fanged creature**, and can cast **Alter Self** once per short rest.

bonus_actions.name: Celerity
bonus_actions.description: Goran's movement speed **triples**, he gains **+1 AC and +1 to Dexterity saves**, and he gains an **extra attack** while active. This lasts for 1 minute and can be used **5 times** (PB) per long rest. This resets on a short rest. Can also be used as a Reaction.

bonus_actions.name: Misty Escape (Bonus Action)
bonus_actions.description: At 9th level, Goran can change to a small cloud of mist as a bonus action and make an immediate reaction move.

reactions.name: Celerity Activation
reactions.description: Goran can use the Celerity ability as a reaction to gain its benefits (triple speed, +1 AC/DEX save, extra attack) and one use of the ability is expended. This resets on a short rest.

reactions.name: Misty Escape (0 HP Trigger)
reactions.description: When reduced to 0 HP outside his resting place, Goran immediately transforms into mist and must reach his resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed.

magic_items.name: Bloodforged Mantle of Spell Resistance
magic_items.description: Grants advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. As a reaction, Goran can spend an infusion to add **+5** to such a saving throw until the end of his next turn (**five uses**).

magic_items.name: Bloodforged Protection Ring
magic_items.description: Goran gains a **+1 bonus to AC and saving throws**. As a reaction, Goran can spend an infusion to gain **10 temporary hit points** (**five uses**).

magic_items.name: Bloodforge Bracers of Flying Daggers
magic_items.description: Allows Goran to pull and immediately hurl up to two magical bloodsteel throwing daggers as part of the attack action (see Actions).

magic_items.name: +1 Longbow
magic_items.description: A longbow with a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls.

tactics.combat_style: Long-range precision strikes followed by brutal close-combat if cornered. He uses **Arcane Shot** to control or cripple key threats, relying on **Action Surge** for burst damage. If his target is vulnerable to being charmed, he attempts to use **Charm** to turn an ally against the party. If overwhelmed, he uses **Celerity** to retreat to a more advantageous position or to double his attack output. If reduced to 0 HP, he attempts to escape using **Misty Escape** to return to his resting place.
tactics.preferred_environment: Subterranean mining tunnels where his **Darkvision** and the lack of sunlight provide a clear advantage. He uses elevation and long sight lines to exploit his **Longbow**.

personality_traits: Meticulous and exacting, with a fixation on order and efficient resource extraction.
Coldly arrogant and dismissive of non-vampiric life, viewing them as mere laborers or cattle.
Unnerved by the sight of holy symbols or divine magic, hinting at his **Fear of Divine Wrath**.
content.ideals: Control. Total control over resources, subordinates, and his own vampiric urges ensures the longevity of the Bloodforge operation.
content.flaws: Lingering Morality. He occasionally suffers a moment of hesitation or moral recoil before harming innocents, which can incapacitate him in crucial moments. He also fears the sun and running water above all else.
allies_friends: Lady Erliza of Snowdown (Liege and Creator)
Various Vampire Spawn and Forced Laborers (Under his command)
foes: Any party interfering with the Bloodforge mining operation
Templars and Priests of the Sun or other Divine Orders
content.era: Defined by the presence of Lady Erliza and Castle Bloodforge.
assumptions: Goran Varus retains his Fighter 5 abilities, including Extra Attack, Archery Fighting Style, Action Surge, and Arcane Archer subclass features, per the 'Keeping Class Abilities and Spells' canon fact.
His Arcane Archer features (Binding Shot and Bursting Shot) are per 2024 RAW, which for a Fighter 5 grants 2 Arcane Shot uses per short/long rest, choosing two different Arcane Shots.
content.canon_update: The mechanics for Bloodforged Mantle of Spell Resistance and Bloodforged Protection Ring were fully defined.

facts.text: Raelith Voss is a Vampire Wizard (Abjurer) responsible for Castle Bloodforge’s magical defenses.
Raelith oversees castle defenses, specializing in Arcane Ward and counterspells against intruders.
He augments Bloodforged constructs with resistance to dispelling and anti-magic.
Grants advantage on saves vs. spells; reaction infusion adds +5 to such saves until end of next turn (five uses).
A rare ring of bloodsteel that increases AC and saving throws, with infusions granting temporary hit points when struck.

She personally charms and controls over 200 mortal servants within Castle Bloodforge to maintain operations and secrecy.

She orchestrated the kidnapping of the King of Alaron's son to extract ransom and force economic dependence.

physics_validator.balance_notes: The CR 10 estimation is likely a **significant underestimate** given Goran's final statistics (AC 20, Saves +11 DEX / +10 CON/CHA, +13 to hit, and 20 HP/turn Regeneration).
